morTimmy Package¶

arduino_motor_driver Module¶

class morTimmy.arduino_motor_driver.Motor(motorID)¶

Bases: morTimmy.motor_driver.MotorDriver

This class is a child of the generic driver for DC Motors. It will contain the class for working together with the DC Motors connected to the arduino through the H-Bridge modules.

The H-Bridge module allows you to control motors in both directions.

Interface will be handled through a serial connection between the raspberry pi and the arduino.

(TODO, write arduino serial remote control library)

getSpeed()¶

This function will return the current speed of the motor

setSpeed(speed)¶

This function will be used to set the speed of the motor

Args:
speed (int): sets the speed of the motor. Valid values are between -255 and 255. Negative numbers will put the motor in reverse. Zero will stop the motor
morTimmy.arduino_motor_driver.main()¶

This function will only be called when the library is run directly Only to be used to do quick tests on the library

arduino_serial_hardware_control Module¶

class morTimmy.arduino_serial_hardware_control.ArduinoSerialController(serialPort='/dev/ttyS0', baudrate=115200, stopbits=1, bytesize=8)¶

Bases: morTimmy.hardware_control.HardwareController

This class is an abstraction layer to allow communication to the low level hardware layer. It will be able to send and receive data from the Arduino microcontroller using a serial interface.

morTimmy.arduino_serial_hardware_control.main()¶

This function will only be called when the library is run directly. Only to be used to do quick tests on the library.

hardware_control Module¶

class morTimmy.hardware_control.HardwareController¶

This class is an abstraction layer to allow communication to the low level hardware layer. It will be able to send and receive data from the microcontroller.

getCommand()¶

This function will retrieve data from the specified module

Returns:
self.__recv (str): Returns a command received from the hardware
controller
sendCommand(command, data='')¶

This function will send a command to the specified module. The command and data size will be predetermined and combined into a single string. This string will be sent to the arduino for parsing.

Args:
command (str): A command can be less than commandSize and will
add trailing whitespaces to meet the required commandSize.
data (str): The data is not mandatory. If no data is provided it will
be padded with whitespaces to meet the required dataSize.
morTimmy.hardware_control.main()¶

This function will only be called when the library is run directly Only to be used to do quick tests on the library.

morTimmy Module¶

class morTimmy.morTimmy.Robot(frontLeftMotorID, frontRightMotorID, rearLeftMotorID, rearRightMotorID)¶

This class will hold the logic for our robot morTimmy. The brain of the robot is a raspberry Pi and the low level electronic are handled by an Arduino. The Arduino provides an interface to the DC motors and various sensors

initialize()¶

This function will (re)initialize the robot. We have this in a seperate function (opposed to __init__) so we can easily reinitialise the robot within our class

run()¶

This function contains the main robot loop as an initial test we’re going to get the robot to spin constantly

morTimmy.morTimmy.main()¶

This is the main function of our script. It will only contain a very limited program logic. The main action happens in the Robot class

motor_driver Module¶

class morTimmy.motor_driver.MotorDriver¶

This class is a generic driver for DC Motors. It will contain the basic skeleton for working with DC motors.

Specific child classes will be created based on this class for different types of motors in the project.

getSpeed()¶

This function will return the current speed of the motor

setSpeed(speed)¶

This function will be used to set the speed of the motor valid values are between -255 and 255. Negative numbers will be used to put the motor in reverse whilst positive numbers will drive the motor forward. zero will stop the motor.

morTimmy.motor_driver.main()¶

This function will only be called when the library is run directly Only to be used to do quick tests on the library.
